title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: George T. Cook to R. S. Lacey, July 31, 1866
summary: Cook's report talks about the inability of free blacks to receive fair trials, as well as the local population's desire to keep freedmen "in their proper place." Cook fears that justice will not be possible until attitudes change.
keywords: Legal System, Violence/Crime, Race Relations, Administration/Bureaucracy, American Civil War
